name: Tarrecite
description:
The world has changed, technology is fueled by the newfound magical mineral Tarrecite. Though, its discovery came at a cost. Ancient evil beings have woken, drawn by the magic of Tarrecite. The Great Arcane War has begun and mankind must fight for survival.

This proof of concept demo includes the first mission of the full game. Explore a ruined world as you battle strange creatures, mine and collect Tarrecite, upgrade your weapons with the magical minerals, and face off against a massive ancient boss.

Or, enter Endless Mode and fight through ever increasing waves of enemies. How long can you last?

Current Features:

• Intro mission that also serves as a tutorial
• Raid Mode: the first mission playable solo or 2-player
• Endless Mode: wave survival playable solo or 2-player
• 21 Weapons: use Tarrecite to upgrade through branching weapon paths in three unique tiers
• 7 Upgrades: improve your movement, defense, damage, and bullet properties
• Full Licensed Soundtrack by Murray Atkinson of rpgmakerweb.com
• Retro-NES Inspired Graphics
• Full Controller Support: xBox style controllers recommended

A Note from the Developer:
Hello Friends, Mike the Nerdy Dude here. Tarrecite is the second project I've worked on and I'm so excited to be able to share it with you. I'm only a year into my journey as an indie game designer but I feel like this game will be the one that I take to a full release. The game engine I'm using, Pixel Game Make MV, is super simple and perfect for someone like me, who has no coding experience but a massive imagination and the drive to bring my ideas to life.
I'll be working on Tarrecite in all of my free time over the coming years, with the hope of bringing it to retail, most likely Steam. By playing and sharing your feedback with me, I'll be able to shape this into the game I know it can be.
My future plans include another full tier of weapon upgrades, bringing the total weapon types to 85! Six total raid missions, each with a unique tile set, objective, atmosphere, and boss battle. As well as new endless modes, enemies, upgrades, and,  of course, 4-Player compatibility.
Thanks again for checking out this project and I hope you have as much fun playing as I had making it.
